intro: Soyeria crocifolia, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Soyeria crocifolia is known for its showy, clustered inflorescences that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often found in shaded areas and can thrive in partial to full sun depending on the region.
